snippet: The deal would be HP’s biggest in more than three years and the first major transaction since it announced plans to split itself in two.
abstract: DealBook Online; Hewlett-Packard will buy Aruba Networks, maker of Wi-Fi access equipment for businesses, for about $3 billion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The deal would be HP’s biggest in more than three years and the first major transaction since it announced plans to split itself in two.

headline.main: HP to Buy Wi-Fi Equipment Maker Aruba Networks for About $3 Billion
